info.author: Sophie Friedl
info.description: extracts paired reads from 2 fastq files.
info.paperDescription: We removed all reads with missing mates from the paired-end fastq files.

param.name: inReads1
param.restrictions: file exists, fastq format (read names without read numbers as /1)
param.description: path to first fastq file with reads

param.name: inReads2
param.restrictions: file exists, fastq format (read names without read numbers as /2)
param.description: path to second fastq file with reads

param.name: inPrefix
param.restrictions: prefix1.[fastq|fq] and prefix2.[fastq|fq] exist and meet the restrictions of inReads1 and inReads2
param.description: reads in two fastq files: prefix1.[fastq|fq], prefix2.[fastq|fq], can be used instead of inReads1 and inReads2

param.name: outReads1
param.description: output file for first reads of paired data

param.name: outReads2
param.description: output file for second reads of paired data

param.name: outSingletons
param.description: output file for singleton reads without a mate

param.name: outPrefix
param.description: writes output to three files: prefix1.fastq, prefix2.fastq, prefixsingleton.fastq, can be used instead of outReads1, outReads2 and outSingleton

var.name: pairedReads1
var.description: output file for first reads of paired data given in the parameters via outReads1 or outPrefix

var.name: singletonReads
var.description: output file for second reads of paired data given in the parameters via outReads2 or outPrefix

var.name: pairedReads2
var.description: output file for singleton reads without a mate given in the parameters via outReads2 or outPrefix
